company.name: Onyx Graphics, Inc.
company.address: 6915 South High Tech Drive, Salt Lake City, Utah 84101
company.business_description: Onyx Graphics develops and markets commercial printing software and solutions for the digital color printing marketplace, including through its website www.onyxgfx.com.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

complaint.factual_background: Onyx Graphics, a commercial printing software company, self-certified to the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework in August 2006 but failed to renew its certification in August 2007. Despite having 'not current' status on the Commerce Department's public website from August 2007 to July 2009, the company continued to represent on its website that it was Safe Harbor certified and complied with Safe Harbor principles.

representations_made.description: Claimed to be Safe Harbor Certified
representations_made.quoted_text:
Safe Harbor Certified
ONYX is Safe Harber [sic] Certified. For ONYX Safe Harbor Agreement, click here. For more information on being Safe Harbor Compliant, click here.

representations_made.description: Claimed to have self-certified privacy practices as consistent with U.S.-EU Safe Harbor principles
representations_made.quoted_text: Onyx has self-certified its privacy practices as consistent with the U.S.-E.U. Safe Harbor principles as published by the US Department of Commerce (the "Principles"). These include: Notice, Choice, Onward Transfer, Access and Accuracy, Security, and Oversight/Enforcement.

representations_made.description: Represented it is a current participant in the Safe Harbor
representations_made.quoted_text: Through the means described in Paragraph 11, respondent represented, expressly or by implication, that it is a current participant in the Safe Harbor.

counts.title: False Safe Harbor Participation Claim
counts.representation: Respondent represented that it is a current participant in the Safe Harbor
counts.fact: From August 2007 to July 2009, respondent was not a current participant in the Safe Harbor
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representations set forth in Paragraph 11 were, and are, false or misleading.

definitions.respondent: Onyx Graphics, Inc. and its subsidiaries, divisions, affiliates, successors and assigns.
definitions.Commerce: as defined in Section 4 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. ยง 44.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Program Participation
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent its membership in, adherence to, or participation in any privacy, security, or compliance program sponsored by the government or third parties.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent participation in privacy, security, or compliance programs
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that respondent and its officers, agents, representatives, and employees, directly or through any corporation, subsidiary, division, website, or other device, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service, in or affecting commerce, shall not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy, security, or any other compliance program sponsored by the government or any other third party.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC all documents relating to compliance with this order for five years.

requirements.description: Maintain records of advertisements and promotional materials for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall maintain and upon request make available to the Federal Trade Commission for inspection and copying, a print or electronic copy of, for a period of five (5) years from the date of preparation or dissemination, whichever is later, all documents relating to compliance with this order, including but not limited to: all advertisements, promotional materials, and any other statements containing any representations covered by this order, with all materials relied upon in disseminating the representation;

requirements.description: Maintain documents that call into question compliance with the order for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that calls into question respondent's compliance with this order.

provisions.title: Order Distribution and Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to current and future personnel with relevant responsibilities and obtain signed acknowledgments.

requirements.description: Deliver order to current personnel and obtain signed acknowledgments
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers, and to all current and future employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order, and shall secure from each such person a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of the order. Respondent shall deliver this order to such current personnel within thirty (30) days after service of this order,

requirements.description: Deliver order to future personnel and obtain signed acknowledgments
requirements.quoted_text: and to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities.

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least 30 days before any corporate changes that may affect compliance obligations.

requirements.description: Notify the Commission 30 days prior to corporate changes affecting compliance
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall notify the Commission at least thirty (30) days prior to any change in the corporation(s) that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including, but not limited to: a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this order; the proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address.

requirements.description: Notify the Commission as soon as practicable if learning of changes fewer than 30 days in advance
requirements.quoted_text: Provided, however, that, with respect to any proposed change in the corporation(s) about which respondent learns fewer than thirty (30) days prior to the date such action is to take place, respondent shall notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a written compliance report with the Commission within 60 days and at such other times as required.

requirements.description: File initial compliance report with the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall, within sixty (60) days after service of this order, and at such other times as the Commission may require, file with the Commission a report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form in which it has complied with this order.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on November 9, 2029, or 20 years from the most recent date a complaint is filed alleging violation of the order, whichever comes later.

requirements.description: Order remains in effect until November 9, 2029, or 20 years from most recent complaint filing
requirements.quoted_text: This order will terminate on November 9, 2029, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: any Part in this order that terminates in fewer than twenty (20) years; this order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and this order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Part.

duration.termination_text: This order will terminate on November 9, 2029, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: any Part in this order that terminates in fewer than twenty (20) years; this order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and this order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Part. Provided, further, that if such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that respondent did not violate any provision of the order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the order as to such respondent will terminate according to this Part as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.
